name: overview
data:
[{"id":"5c4b5ab1-8179-4930-861b-6ebb32878615","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group: Call Graph Structure Outputs","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"71441658-3116-4068-8a31-f03bea418c4f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This sub-group provides access to the "spatial" results of the analysis—the connections between functions. These methods are designed to feed into visualization engines, reporting tools, or graph databases by exposing the directed edges and nodes that represent the project's execution flow.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ce093d73-1fa5-439c-a53e-675b7700d2a7","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"36542819-413e-4039-95ff-b37488ca262a","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cb8d3d17-2d7e-4d24-b6e3-8f590b79bec4","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"output()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Retrieves the raw, internal adjacency list of the call graph. It returns the dictionary where each key is a caller namespace and the value is a set of all callee namespaces.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"12451ce1-c6e9-45c4-bd1a-67bb7a75b59a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"output_edges()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The primary method for retrieving call relationships. It transforms the internal graph into a flat list of source-destination pairs (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"[["app.run", "db.connect"], ...]","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). This is the canonical format for building dependency maps and visual call graphs.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0c8b3bb8-27e0-4c33-8c6e-9764edc1202a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_as_graph()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Exposes the raw definition data (the nodes of the graph) directly from the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"DefinitionManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Unlike ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"output_edges","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which focuses on the connections, this method provides access to the underlying metadata of the nodes themselves, which is useful for specialized visualization tools that need to distinguish between function types, classes, or modules.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1e96c53e-1614-4ba1-a20e-5325d3333dbf","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"26702a33-d3fe-4c25-aee7-50242863df82","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"17633257-9f7e-4460-a8a5-a64842c09bd3","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The data from these methods is typically passed to a formatter to create final artifacts like JSON or DOT files.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d8691724-5cf0-4b47-b7e0-3a4e1e5a37aa","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"# 1. Get a flat list of edges for a dependency report
all_calls = cg_gen.output_edges()
for call in all_calls:
    caller, callee = call
    print(f"Flow: {caller} -> {callee}")

# 2. Get the raw graph for custom processing
raw_cg = cg_gen.output()
if "main.start" in raw_cg:
    print(f"Start function calls {len(raw_cg['main.start'])} sub-functions.")","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"876ecbcf-fe10-4f4b-8889-707ad8c33acc","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"804470e2-4b6d-4156-adbc-6452d359f595","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Graph Transformation","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": These methods serve as the "adapter" between the complex internal state (heaps, sets, and managers) and the simplified formats required by external tools.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"72719514-f193-463b-a1da-544afa03060a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Redundancy Handling","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": Because the internal ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CallGraph","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" uses sets to store destinations, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"output_edges","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ensures that multiple identical calls (e.g., calling ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"logger.info","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" twice in one function) result in a single logical edge, keeping graph visualizations clean and readable.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"30ea9130-b982-45ce-bee0-b0854600a120","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Unreachable Code Note","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The first ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"output_edges","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" implementation in the source is shadowed by the second, effectively making the second definition (which returns the call edges) the only active implementation.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b1a85582-fddd-4fb8-9396-36ff76d317be","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
